Regular Weekday Service Expected for Tues. Morning, Feb. 16

Metro-North Railroad expects to operate on a regular weekday schedule tomorrow morning, Tuesday, February 16, 2016, following power disruptions to Grand Central Terminal that took place on Monday. However, the railroad advises customers to be prepared for the potential for 20-30 minute delays if lingering, limited power problems continue to impact lighting on the Lower Level of Grand Central. Please check for service updates at www.mta.info/mnr .

Hail to the Chiefs: President's Day Service (Monday, Feb. 15)

On Presidents' Day, Monday, February 15, MetroNorth will operate a Saturday schedule with some extra cars on trains during AM-inbound and PM-outbound hours. The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th, 47th, 48th Streets will be closed. Offpeak fares are in effect all day. See train schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm

On Presidents' Day, Monday, February 15, MetroNorth will operate a Saturday schedule with some extra cars on trains during AM-inbound and PM-outbound hours. The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th, 47th, 48th Streets will be closed. Offpeak fares are in effect all day. See train schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm

The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th47th48th Streets will be closed. Hail to the Chiefs: President's Day Service (Monday, Feb. 15)

On Presidents' Day, Monday, February 15, MetroNorth will operate a Saturday schedule with some extra cars on trains during AM-inbound and PM-outbound hours. The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th47th48th Streets will be closed. Offpeak fares are in effect all day. See train schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm

Hail to the Chiefs: President's Day Service (Monday, Feb. 15)

On Presidents' Day, Monday, February 15, MetroNorth will operate a Saturday schedule with some extra cars on trains during AM-inbound and PM-outbound hours. The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th47th48th Streets will be closed. Offpeak fares are in effect all day. See train schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm

Hail to the Chiefs: President's Day Service (Monday, Feb. 15)

On Presidents' Day, Monday, February 15, MetroNorth will operate a Saturday schedule with some extra cars on trains during AM-inbound and PM-outbound hours. The Hudson Rail Link connecting bus service, the NewburghBeacon Ferry and the HaverstrawOssining Ferry will not operate. The north end exits to Grand Central at 46th47th48th Streets will be closed. Non-stop between Kings Hwy and Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr. 2. Local via Ocean Av between Kings Hwy and Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr, making all stops. To Manhattan, take the D, F, or N from Stillwell Av. N Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Change

All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
M Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

6 AM to 12 midnight, Sat and Sun, Feb 6 - 7 No M trains between Myrtle Av and Essex St. Take the J, L and/or free shuttle buses instead. M service operates between Metropolitan Av and Myrtle Av all weekend. Use the J for service between Myrtle Av and Hewes St. Free shuttle buses provide alternate service between Hewes St and Essex St, stopping at Marcy Av. Transfer between J and M trains at Myrtle Av. Transfer between J trains and free shuttle buses at Hewes St. For direct service to/from Manhattan, use the L. This service change affects one or more ADA accessible stations. Please call 511 for help with planning your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay. For more information, click on the mta.info link in this email and read station signs.
J Line - Weekend Planned Service Change

11:30 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Feb 5 - 8 No J trains between Hewes St and Broad St. Take free shuttle buses and 4, 6, and F trains.
